result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony C. Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied, any remaining fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations, which should include anger management counseling,  as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall have no contact with Shari Haynes of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way unless it is approved by the victim and the agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony C. Nichols

records.addlTxt: Motion to substitute as counsel   Attorney Anne Terrien in place of Attorney Fredrickson
Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Tony C. Nichols, appeared with Attorney Anne Terrien.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2016 at 08:20 am.
Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Tony C. Nichols, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Agreement reached  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 08:20 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 5, 2016 at 08:50 am.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Tony C. Nichols, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.    The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:50 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with S. H. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
